intro: Hieracium commersonii var. kingii, commonly known as the King's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and disturbed soils, exhibiting a low-growing, mat-forming habit. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. This variant is distinguished by its slightly different leaf morphology and floral structure compared to other members of the species.
